comments.body: @ryansb @s-hertel Do we want new modules directly in this directory, or do you want to move to `module_utils/cloud/memset/memset.py` as was done with network libraries in https://github.com/ansible/proposals/issues/76
My rule of thumb is if there will be more than one module (memset_foo, memset_bar, ...) it's worth making a directory. So this would be a question for the contributor.

As things currently stand I can't see that the current module will grow massively. Although I intend exposing more of Memset's API it will be as and when I have time, so if the time comes to split them out I can always do that at a later date.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +-1,3 @@# This code is part of Ansible, but is an independent component.

# Modules you write using this snippet, which is embedded dynamically by Ansible
